bulletin_message.00:
The goblin approaches, revealing itself a bit shorter than expected. "BONES! BONES!" They shout in a playful, almost childish voice.

"BOOOONEEES!" They continue.

It seems to be harmless.

Is that a child? Are there goblin children?

They're clearly happy about it, hopping around in circles. "BONES! BONES! MANY BONES!"

Suddenly, a stern and yet compassionate hearthling voice rumbles nearby. "There you are, Rattley!"

He wears the colors of the Northern Alliance. Strong and grizzled, he rests his hand on the head of the little goblin. "So there you are! Going out and making friends, eh?"

He notices the people around. "I apologize. Name's Thorulf, traveler and former Scout of the Library."

With a gentle pat the goblin goes back to jumping around.

"What?" he thunders. "No, don't call her a pet! She's a goblin - not a squirrel. They're people too, you know?"

He coughs, waving his hand as an apology.

"I apologize. It's just... We've been through a lot, Rattley and I." He looks on her direction as she plays with a small bone club. "Unfortunately not many places are prepared to accept or at least try to understand goblins..."

"Rattley is like a daughter to me." he says with a bittersweet smile "I am the reason she is alone in the world and she is the reason I left the Library. One watches over the other now!" he laughs, shoving away the past back where it belongs.

"I know you are busy so we'll go find a place to camp for some days!" He waves his hand, calling Rattley closer.

"Oh, I was almost forgetting..." he scratches the back of his head and smirks "I'll be busy setting up camp and won't have time to hunt so soon... Would you mind gifting little Rattley a couple of bones?"

The little goblin reacts to it. "BONES! GIVE BONES!"

Thorulf stares back at her "Rattley, what have I told you?".

She looks down "Please?"

Thorulf smiles "We would appreciate it, she loves carving them!"

"Good!" he exclaims, before turning around. "We'll be nearby. Stay warm!"

They start walking away.

bone_gift_quest.title: Bones for Rattley
bone_gift_quest.text: The little goblin loves carving things out of bone!

bulletin_message.00:
She quickly grab the materials. "BONES! BONES!"

Behind her, Thorulf is finishing setting up the camp. "Rattley, thank them for the gift!"

She looks back before continuing. "BONES! You make Rattley happy!"

"Greetings once more, friends!" says the northerner as he puts a small bowl for feeding pets by your banner. "Rattley is showing herself to be a very promising bone carver!"

"BONES!" She seems very happy and grateful.

Thorulf seems very proud "We think you should have her latest creation."

Thorulf looks around, scratching his moustache "You folks from the southern lands are not used to carving bones."

He raises his brows, clearly having an idea "I'm teaching Rattley, one more apprentice wouldn't hurt. We'll go on a hunting trip soon and I can teach a Mason, if willing." he smiles "All I ask is some supplies for the days we'll be gone."

"AND BONES!" cheers Rattley.

"You welcome!" says Rattley with a smile.

Thorulf pats her on the head before continuing "She is a great apprentice. Bone carving is an art as ancient as the stars, very important to my people." he rests his hand over his own heart "Curiously enough it's also a tradition for the goblins."

Thorulf seems a bit disappointed.

"Well, I'm sure you know what is best for your people!" he smiles and takes a deep breath in "We'll go on our hunting trip and move on afterwards. We might come around here sometime soon if you wish to reconsider!"

He nods and turns around to leave as Rattley waves goodbye to everyone.

Thorulf rejoices "Hah, good! I knew you'd appreciate the invitation. It's hard to not appreciate intricate bone craftsmanship!"

"BONES!" cheers Rattley once more "BONE FRIEND!"

"We will head back to our camp, send your Mason our way whenever they're ready!"

Thorulf sighs. "Well, sometimes things just get in the way, eh?" he smiles "But I am sure we shall cross our paths again. Rattley surely wants to."

"BONE FRIEND!" she cheers.

"Maybe next time we're around we could even teach you a bit about bone carving! Well, off we go!"

hunting_trip_supplies_quest.title: Supplies for the trip
hunting_trip_supplies_quest.dialog_title: They'll need some food and some bones for Rattley.
hunting_trip_supplies_quest.text: And a bandage or two. Just for safety!

mason_dispatch_quest.text: Select a Mason (Level 2+) to learn Bone Carving with Thorulf and Rattley!
mason_dispatch_quest.title: Select a Mason

bulletin_message.00:
"BONES!" she cheers as she jumps around the town banner "We back, bone friend!"

Behind her, Thorulf and the Mason calmly approach while having a friendly conversation.

"There you go!" says Thorulf as they approach, he laughs "Your Mason is back safely, well fed and full of knowledge to share!"

Rattley silently approaches and holds on to the leg of her father, who continues "I'm afraid it is time to say goodbye, now. Hopefully this knowledge will serve you very well from now on."

He smiles. "May the stars always shine the brightest upon your town. Farewell!"

bone_recipes_unlock.bulletin_title: New Bone Carving recipes for the Mason!

bulletin_message.00:
"Many greetings! It seems our paths have crossed again." he smiles.

Rattley jumps in front of him "BONE FRIEND!"

They laugh and Thorulf continues "She insisted to come. We have a proposition!" he shows some of his own bone carved tools as he continues "We're going on another hunting trip nearby and maybe a Mason would be interested in learning bone carving?"

"Good to know you have interest!" he smiles, opening his arms wide "We can leave as soon as you're ready. But since we'll be out for a couple of days, some supplies wouldn't hurt... If that is alright!"

Rattley waves from behind his legs. "AND BONES!"

"And bones, of course!" he laughs.

"Oh, I understand." he gives a gentle yet disappointed smile.

"No bones?" Rattley sobs.

"Maybe next time, right? I'm sure they must be very busy. Sometimes this is just how things are!" he seems genuinely interested in teaching others, maybe someday he might return.

"We wish you the best of luck and may the stars always shine upon your town!"

highlands.description: Uneven valleys and tall cliffs with many lakes and rivers. Default home of the Mountain Folk.

spring.description:
Spring in the Highlands is a time of renewal, usually full of windy days and a good time to start sowing. Late snow may rarely occur.
  • Daytime sunlight levels are average.
  • Humidity is alright.

summer.description:
Summer in the Highlands is a warm and wet season, often with days of rain and maybe even storms. Strong winds and a cloudless sky will probably prevail, however.
  • Daytime sunlight levels are good.
  • Humidity is mostly scarce.

autumn.description:
Autumn in the Highlands marks the end of the farming season, with several rainy or cloudy days and perhaps even an early snowfall.
  • Daytime sunlight levels are average.
  • Humidity is high.

winter.description:
Winter in the Highlands can be harsh and severe, lasting slightly longer than the other seasons and with an almost daily snowfall. Get your warm clothes ready!
  • Daytime sunlight levels are meager.
  • Humidity is very high.

spring.description:
Spring in the Forest is a season of rebirth, lasting three months. Rains melt the snows, revealing new growth hidden underneath, and trees come back to life covered with colorful blossoms.
  • Daytime sunlight levels are good.
  • Humidity is plentiful.

summer.description:
Summer in the Forest is the mildest season, lasting three months. It is a time to relax and bask in the sun, without worrying about storms or snow.
  • Daytime sunlight levels are very good.
  • Humidity is high.

autumn.description:
Autumn in the Forest is the harvest season, lasting three months. The trees turn to gold, and the grass prepares to retreat into its winter blanket, as the skies darken with storm clouds.
  • Daytime sunlight levels are average.
  • Humidity is very high.

winter.description:
Winter in the Forest is a cold season, lasting three months. Trees lose their leaves, and snow covers the landscape. The cold, biting winds are best countered by cosy gatherings around the hearth.
  • Daytime sunlight levels are poor.
  • Humidity is high.

spring.description:
Spring in the Desert is the wet season, lasting two months. It is a rare time for the water reserves to be replenished, leading the local flora to all bloom at once.
  • Daytime sunlight levels are very good.
  • Slightly dry season.

summer.description:
Summer in the Desert is the storm season, lasting four months. Sandstorms ravage the landscape on almost a daily basis, and a town without ample shelter, be it walls, mountains, or underground dwellings, may have trouble surviving the onslaught.
  • Daytime sunlight levels are excessive.
  • Unbearably dry season.

autumn.description:
Autumn in the Desert is the quiet season, lasting four months. The weather is hot, but milder than in the summer, with neither sandstorms nor precipitation. It is traditionally a time to rest after surviving the sandstorms of summer.
  • Daytime sunlight levels are good.
  • Quite dry season.

winter.description:
Winter in the Desert is a cool season, lasting two months. Breezes blow over the dunes, bringing with them milder weather than in the autumn, and even the occasional snow cloud.
  • Daytime sunlight levels are average.
  • Extremely dry season.

spring.description:
Spring in the Arctic is a season of change, only lasting one month. While the highlands retain their snow cover year-round, the lowlands around the lakes start to thaw out and young grass begins to sprout.
  • Daytime sunlight levels are average.
  • Humidity is alright.

summer.description:
Summer in the Arctic is a season of rest, lasting three months. The weather is mild, and the lowlands are green with grass. It is a reprieve from the cold, and a time to regather strength for the long winter to come.
  • Daytime sunlight levels are good.
  • Humidity is mostly scarce.

autumn.description:
Autumn in the Arctic is a season of freeze, only lasting one month. Although blizzards are rare, snow is a daily occurrence. It is the last chance to build shelter before the unforgiving winter arrives.
  • Daytime sunlight levels are poor.
  • Humidity is high.

winter.description:
Winter in the Arctic is a season of hardship, lasting seven months. Weather is severe, with biting winds and unforgiving blizzards making farming exceedingly difficult. Even venturing outside without a winter outfit can end tragically.
  • Daytime sunlight levels are inadequate.
  • Very dry season.

windy.description:
Howling winds and roaring gales sweep the lands.
  • Normal sunlight levels.
  • Slightly increased humidity.

windy_chilly.description:
The air is dry and cold as the winds howl across the lands.
  • Normal sunlight levels.
  • Regular humidity levels.
  • Unsheltered hearthlings are too chilly to work as effectively.

thunderstorm.description:
Thunder rolled... It rolled a six.
  • Extremely reduced sunlight levels.
  • Disastrously increased humidity.
  • Vision radius is reduced.
  • Unsheltered hearthlings and pasture animals get soaked wet.
  • Unsheltered hearthlings sometimes get hit by lightning.
  • The ground and trees sometimes get hit by lightning.

sunny.description:
Yet another day of endless sunshine and blue skies.
  • Normal sunlight levels.
  • Barely reduced humidity.

sunny_desert.description:
Yet another day of endless sunshine and blue skies.
  • Normal sunlight levels.
  • Reduced humidity.

sunny_chilly.description:
It's a beautiful, sunny day! Even if also somewhat cold...
  • Barely reduced sunlight levels.
  • Regular humidity levels.
  • Unsheltered hearthlings are too chilly to work as effectively.

sunny_hot.description:
A nice and warm sunny day! Maybe too sunny, the heat is not good...
  • Normal sunlight levels.
  • Fairly reduced humidity.
  • Unsheltered hearthlings are too hot to work as effectively.
  • Unsheltered pasture animals are affected by the heat.

sunny_sweltering.description:
An unbearably hot and stale weather has come upon the town this day.
  • Normal sunlight levels.
  • Reduced humidity.
  • Unsheltered hearthlings are sweltering and might get a heatstroke if too exposed to the sun.
  • Unsheltered pasture animals are hurt by the heat.

snow.description:
Cold, frost, and the sun decided to hide. Can we just stay inside?
  • Fairly reduced sunlight levels.
  • Regular humidity levels.
  • Vision radius is slightly reduced.
  • Unsheltered hearthlings are too cold to work as effectively.
  • Unsheltered pasture animals are hurt by the cold.

snow_sunny.description:
What a beautiful winter wonderland it is today!
  • Slightly reduced sunlight levels.
  • Regular humidity levels.
  • Vision radius is only slightly reduced.
  • Unsheltered hearthlings are too chilly to work as effectively.

snow_early.description:
Snow has come earlier this year...
  • Reduced sunlight levels.
  • Regular humidity levels.
  • Unsheltered hearthlings are too chilly to work as effectively.

snow_late.description:
There's still snow to fall this year...
  • Fairly reduced sunlight levels.
  • Regular humidity levels.
  • Unsheltered hearthlings are too cold to work as effectively.
  • Unsheltered pasture animals are hurt by the cold.

sandstorm.description:
Cover your eyes. Cover your ears. In fact, just stay inside.
  • Clouds of sand pass across the landscape, destroying crops and hurting everyone.
  • Extremely reduced sunlight levels.
  • Extremely reduced humidity.
  • Vision radius is slightly reduced.
  • Unsheltered hearthlings are sweltering and might get a heatstroke if exposed to the storm's heat too much.
  • Unsheltered pasture animals are hurt by the heat.

sandy_day.description:
There is sand and dust... everywhere!
  • Fairly reduced sunlight levels.
  • Greatly reduced humidity.
  • Vision radius is only slightly reduced.
  • Unsheltered hearthlings are too hot to work as effectively.
  • Unsheltered pasture animals are affected by the heat.

rain.description:
Water! Water from the skies!
  • Fairly reduced sunlight levels.
  • Excessively increased humidity.
  • Vision radius is reduced.
  • Unsheltered hearthlings and pasture animals get soaked wet.

rain_sunny.description:
It's raining, but the sun is peeking out!
  • Barely reduced sunlight levels.
  • Extremely increased humidity.
  • Vision radius is only slightly reduced.
  • Unsheltered hearthlings and pasture animals get soaked wet.

rain_chilly.description:
It's like an endless shower of really thin ice needles!
  • Fairly reduced sunlight levels.
  • Severely increased humidity.
  • Vision radius is reduced.
  • Unsheltered hearthlings are too chilly to work as effectively.
  • Unsheltered pasture animals get soaked wet.

lucky.description:
Today, everything is just a tiny bit better.
  • Normal sunlight levels.
  • Greatly increased humidity
  • Hearthlings find all their ailments healed, as if by magic.
  • Hearthlings are slightly luckier in everything they do.
  • A mysterious rainbow sometimes appears.

foggy.description:
A cover of fog crawls across the landscape, hiding untold mysteries.
  • Undead monsters come out of hiding under the cover of the fog.
  • Reduced sunlight levels.
  • Highly increased humidity.
  • Vision radius is greatly reduced.

cloudy.description:
Overcast skies, perfect for lazing around on the porch.
  • Fairly reduced sunlight levels.
  • Slightly increased humidity.

cloudy_chilly.description:
Dark skies and a chilly breeze sweeping over.
  • Fairly reduced sunlight levels.
  • Regular humidity levels.
  • Unsheltered hearthlings are too chilly to work as effectively.

cloudy_cold.description:
The clouds are heavy and dark, the air is dry and cold.
  • Fairly reduced sunlight levels.
  • Regular humidity levels.
  • Unsheltered hearthlings are too cold to work as effectively.
  • Unsheltered pasture animals are hurt by the cold.

blizzard.description:
Wind, and snow, and hail, oh my!
  • Extremely reduced sunlight levels.
  • Quite reduced humidity.
  • Vision radius is greatly reduced.
  • Unsheltered hearthlings are hurt by the cold.
  • Unsheltered pasture animals are hurt by the cold.

snow_early_positive.tooltip: I've waited the whole year for this, the snow season is finally upon us!

snow_early_negative.tooltip: Can't believe we're getting snow this early, darkness and cold approaches!

snow_late_positive.tooltip: I'm glad we can enjoy one more day of snow before the snow season ends!

snow_late_negative.tooltip: Winter should be over already, can't believe we're getting such late snowfall...

cloudy_chilly_positive.tooltip: Fluffy clouds and a nice, chilly air! This is a nice day.

cloudy_chilly_negative.tooltip: As if having the sun covered by those clouds wasn't enough, it's also really chilly today!

cloudy_cold_positive.tooltip: Cloudy and cold days are the best! I love winter!

cloudy_cold_negative.tooltip: It's dark, gloomy clouds above us, a biting cold... What could be worse?

foggy_chilly_positive.tooltip: Oh! This foggy is so mysterious! And this chilly sensation on the back of the neck... Love it!

foggy_chilly_negative.tooltip: It's too cold and this fog is too thick! There is something wrong going on, I'll tell you!

rain_chilly_positive.tooltip: This freezing rain feels somewhat refreshing, I wonder if we'll get snow soon?

rain_chilly_negative.tooltip: I can't stand this boring tickling of thin, freezing rain. Ugh!

sunny_chilly_positive.tooltip: Ah! What a wonderful feeling, there is nothing like the bright sun on a nice winter's day.

sunny_chilly_negative.tooltip: Oh, it's nice to finally see the sun again... but could we at least get some warmth too?

sunny_hot_positive.tooltip: The sun is so strong today! It can be a little punishing but makes me feel so alive!

sunny_hot_negative.tooltip: Why does it have to be so warm today? I can't take this heat anymore...

sunny_sweltering_positive.tooltip: I know, I know... It is extremely hot. But that means we get to stay more under the shade, right?

sunny_sweltering_negative.tooltip: This is definitely not healthy... Must stay away from the sun... Must stay refreshed...

windy_chilly_positive.tooltip: Nothing feels as refreshing as the gentle and cold arctic wind sweeping across your face!

windy_chilly_negative.tooltip: It feels like a thousand of little cold blades on my face... Ugh!

ate_intolerable.tooltip: I recently had [str(foodname)]... I'm not feeling well...

dairy_intolerant_ate_dairy.tooltip: Unfortunately [str(foodname)] really doesn't go well with my stomach... Ouch...

nuts_intolerant_ate_nuts.tooltip: Ugh... That [str(foodname)] looked nice but I guess it isn't for me...

fish_intolerant_ate_fish.tooltip: I'm never having [str(foodname)] again. Never! Ouch...

ate_lovely.tooltip: I had [str(foodname)]! I want more! I'm so happy about it!

dairy_lover_ate_dairy.tooltip: Yes! I'm so glad I could eat [str(foodname)] today! It's definitely one of the things I love the most!

meat_lover_ate_meat.tooltip: Hmmm... That [str(foodname)] was delicious. I love meat, all kinds of meat - but that one was just amazing!

vegetable_lover_ate_vegetable.tooltip: I can't believe how good [str(foodname)] was. How can such delicious things come from the ground?

fungi_lover_ate_fungi.tooltip: Yum! I love eating fungi, and I must admit [str(foodname)] was particularly good!

teddy.tooltip: I was visited by the adorable ghost of a very mischievous kitten called Teddy!

merry_time.tooltip: Friends, drinks and a good time! What else could anyone wish for?

morning_after.tooltip: Ugh... Bleh! Everything aches and my head is so heavy. Should not exaggerate so much...

dairy_intolerant_had_dairy.tooltip: I suppose I didn't have any better option other than the [str(drinkname)] that is now making me feel really sick...

alcohol_intolerant_had_alcohol.tooltip: I can't stand alcoholic drinks and taking in that [str(drinkname)] was an awful feeling that I hope to never experience again!

alcohol_lover_had_alcohol.tooltip: Woohoo, make way for this happy hearthling that just enjoyed an amazing [str(drinkname)]! Is there more?

juice_lover_had_juice.tooltip: Yes, I loved that [str(drinkname)]! Juices are the best thing ever, aren't they?

tea_lover_had_tea.tooltip: Hmm... Balance. I feel like this [str(drinkname)] has brought me to a perfect, tranquil state. Nothing can go wrong after this...

dairy_lover_had_dairy.tooltip: I could hug the animal that provided me with that delicious [str(drinkname)]! Hearty and healthy!

had_item_quality_fine.tooltip: There was something particularly special about this [str(drinkname)]. Whoever made it should be congratulated!

had_item_quality_excellent.tooltip: Hmmm, this [str(drinkname)] was incredible! Or should I say... Excellent? I hope there is more for later!

had_item_quality_masterwork.tooltip: I should stop everything and go congratulate whoever made this [str(drinkname)] I had today. It was simply brilliant, the work of a master!

intolerable.tooltip: I've had something intolerable, [str(drinkname)]... I really shouldn't do that anymore, it's unbearable.

unpalatable.tooltip: After finishing this [str(drinkname)] I just can't really think anything other than how bad it was.

raw.tooltip: After a sip or two of the [str(drinkname)] I already knew it wasn't... much.

prepared.tooltip: The effort put into the [str(drinkname)] I just enjoyed is noticeable and can't be denied!

bland.tooltip: I had that [str(drinkname)] and it wasn't particularly tasty... I've had better things before!

tasty.tooltip: Shortly after drinking [str(drinkname)] I already feel like I could drink much more! It was delicious!

lovely.tooltip: Ah, what a wonderful day! Enjoying that lovely [str(drinkname)] has made everything better already.

average.tooltip: [str(drinkname)] was not the best but it wasn't bad either! Honestly, it was quite alright!

sated.tooltip: Hmm, I've really enjoyed some beverages recently. I'll be good for a while...

thirsty.tooltip: I haven't had a drink in some time... Could use the refreshment soon.

very_thirsty.tooltip: Uh, I'm so dry... I need to drink something!

good_dream.tooltip: Hmm... Is that a pot of gold? Oh my, I must be dreaming...

bad_dream.tooltip: No... No... Run away, the giant poyo is here! FLY, YOU FOOLS!

levels.description: Gained by levelling up on any job.
levels.6_description: They have six job levels! They have walked the path of a master!
levels.12_description: They now have twelve job levels! More than a master, a grand master!
levels.18_description: They have eighteen job levels! What? That's amazing!
levels.30_description: They've reached thirty job levels, only few and dedicated souls can achieve that...
levels.60_description: They've reached the impressive mark of sixty job levels! That's more experience than many hearthlings combined... Such wisdom!
levels.90_description: They have ninety job levels - this is unbelievable! No hearthling could ever dream of such a feat... Their soul must've been touched by Cid himself!

slayer.100_description: They defeated 100 foes! Was that really necessary?
slayer.250_description: They defeated 250 foes! They can't be stopped!
slayer.600_description: They defeated 600 foes! That has to be a war crime or something...

slayer_item.100_description: It defeated 100 foes! Probably needs some polishing.
slayer_item.250_description: It defeated 250 foes! This should be enough.

goblin_killer.10_description: They killed 10 goblins! There they went, killing again!
goblin_killer.25_description: They killed 25 goblins! They're really good at it!
goblin_killer.50_description: They killed 50 goblins! That's a lot!
goblin_killer.75_description: They killed 75 goblins! Where are they finding all these goblins?!
goblin_killer.100_description: They killed 100 goblins! Perhaps they should be in therapy, reexamining their priorities.

goblin_killer_item.10_description: It killed 10 goblins! Will it stop?
goblin_killer_item.25_description: It killed 25 goblins! It's really good at it!
goblin_killer_item.50_description: It killed 50 goblins! That's a lot!
goblin_killer_item.75_description: It killed 75 goblins! It's unstoppable, at least by goblins!
goblin_killer_item.100_description: It killed 100 goblins! Has its blood lust finally been sated?

orc_killer.description: Gained by killing followers of the Red Kiln.
orc_killer.5_description: They killed 5 followers of the Red Kiln!
orc_killer.10_description: They killed 10 followers of the Red Kiln! What a challenger!
orc_killer.25_description: They killed 25 followers of the Red Kiln! That requires some skills!
orc_killer.50_description: They killed 50 followers of the Red Kiln! Will they ever stop?
orc_killer.75_description: They killed 75 followers of the Red Kiln! Surely the orcs are convinced by now?
orc_killer.100_description: They killed 100 followers of the Red Kiln! They are worthy of this land!

orc_killer_item.description: Gained by killing followers of the Red Kiln.
orc_killer_item.5_description: It killed 5 followers of the Red Kiln!
orc_killer_item.10_description: It killed 10 followers of the Red Kiln! A fine weapon!
orc_killer_item.25_description: It killed 25 followers of the Red Kiln! That's something!
orc_killer_item.50_description: It killed 50 followers of the Red Kiln! It strikes fear in their hearts!
orc_killer_item.75_description: It killed 75 followers of the Red Kiln! Nothing can stop it!
orc_killer_item.100_description: It killed 100 followers of the Red Kiln! This land is finally safe.

undead_killer.6_description: They killed 6 undead! Is 'killed' even the proper word?
undead_killer.25_description: They killed 25 undead! It feels safer already.
undead_killer.50_description: They killed 50 undead! The long night is over.

undead_killer_item.6_description: It killed 6 undead! What a blessing!
undead_killer_item.15_description: It killed 15 undead! Should be safe to go out tonight.
undead_killer_item.25_description: It killed 25 undead! It definitely did its part!
undead_killer_item.50_description: It killed 50 undead! A beacon of hope!

forest_killer.description: Gained by killing minions of the Wilds.
forest_killer.5_description: They killed 5 minions of the Wilds!
forest_killer.10_description: They killed 10 minions of the Wilds! Entlings, beware!
forest_killer.25_description: They killed 25 minions of the Wilds! Where's the howling now?
forest_killer.50_description: They killed 50 minions of the Wilds! It feels calmer out there...
forest_killer.75_description: They killed 75 minions of the Wilds! Deforestation is a crime!
forest_killer.100_description: They killed 100 minions of the Wilds! Shouldn't nature be your friend?

forest_killer_item.description: Gained by killing minions of the Wilds.
forest_killer_item.5_description: It killed 5 minions of the Wilds!
forest_killer_item.10_description: It killed 10 minions of the Wilds! Firewood, anyone?
forest_killer_item.25_description: It killed 25 minions of the Wilds! A ranger would be proud!
forest_killer_item.50_description: It killed 50 minions of the Wilds! What did nature do to it?
forest_killer_item.75_description: It killed 75 minions of the Wilds! It's time to stop, perhaps?
forest_killer_item.100_description: It killed 100 minions of the Wilds! Nature will never forget this!

titan_killer.5_description: They killed 5 corrupted beings! Such bravery!
titan_killer.10_description: They killed 10 corrupted beings! They stood against darkness!
titan_killer.15_description: They killed 15 corrupted beings! Made a difference during the last battle.
titan_killer.25_description: They killed 25 corrupted beings! They tipped the odds of light against darkness!

titan_killer_item.10_description: It killed 10 corrupted beings! Worthy of a song!
titan_killer_item.15_description: It killed 15 corrupted beings! A weapon of legend!
titan_killer_item.25_description: It killed 25 corrupted beings! This world shall remember its name.

ogre_killer.30_description: They killed 30 ogres! Size really doesn't matter.

ogre_killer_item.12_description: It killed 12 ogres! Maybe it was designed for that?
ogre_killer_item.30_description: It killed 30 ogres! What an epic weapon!

mountain_killer.description: Gained by killing the ogre boss.
mountain_killer.1_description: They've killed the most fearsome ogre!

mountain_killer_item.description: Gained by killing the ogre boss.
mountain_killer_item.1_description: It was used to kill the most fearsome ogre!

varanus_killer.description: Gained by killing varani and such.
varanus_killer.10_description: They killed 10 lizards! Careful with their teeth!
varanus_killer.25_description: They killed 25 lizards! But no dragons yet...
varanus_killer.50_description: They killed 50 lizards! The species is probably endangered!

varanus_killer_item.description: Gained by killing varani and such.
varanus_killer_item.25_description: It killed 25 lizards! Probably needs cleaning!
varanus_killer_item.50_description: It killed 50 lizards! Probably some amphibians too.

zilla_killer.description: Gained by killing the lizard boss.
zilla_killer.1_description: They've killed the most fearsome lizard!

zilla_killer_item.description: Gained by killing the lizard boss.
zilla_killer_item.1_description: It was used to kill the most fearsome lizard!

leader_killer.3_description: They killed 3 enemy leaders! Cut the serpent's head!
leader_killer.5_description: They killed 5 enemy leaders! Enemies won't settle here...
leader_killer.10_description: They killed 10 enemy leaders! Chaos in their ranks!

leader_killer_item.5_description: It killed 5 enemy leaders! They'll think twice now...
leader_killer_item.10_description: It killed 10 enemy leaders! It loves anarchy!

ogo_killer.description: Gained by killing the goblin boss.
ogo_killer.1_description: They've killed the most fearsome goblin!

ogo_killer_item.description: Gained by killing the goblin boss.
ogo_killer_item.1_description: It was used to kill the most fearsome goblin!

warchief_killer.description: Gained by defeating the orc boss.
warchief_killer.1_description: They've bested the most fearsome orc in combat!

warchief_killer_item.description: Gained by defeating the orc boss.
warchief_killer_item.1_description: It was used to best the most fearsome orc in combat!

hunter.30_description: They hunted 30 wild animals! Poor animals...
hunter.75_description: They hunted 75 wild animals! That's food for months!
hunter.150_description: They hunted 150 wild animals! Is it an obsession?
hunter.300_description: They hunted 300 wild animals! Someone really loves barbecue!
hunter.600_description: They hunted 600 wild animals! Be careful to not cause an extinction!

hunter_item.30_description: It hunted 30 wild animals! It has just started!
hunter_item.75_description: It hunted 75 wild animals! A true hunting weapon!
hunter_item.150_description: It hunted 150 wild animals! No forest is safe...
hunter_item.300_description: It hunted 300 wild animals! That's a lot of jerky.
hunter_item.600_description: It hunted 600 wild animals! Vegetarians must hate it!

defender.description: Gained by getting kill assists (being involved in combat directly with or near killed enemies).
defender.25_description: They defended the town from 25 enemies!
defender.50_description: They defended the town from 50 enemies!
defender.100_description: They defended the town from 100 enemies! Is it finally safe?
defender.500_display_name: the Long Floating Hand of the Law
defender.500_description: They defended the town from 500 enemies! What an incredibly adversarial town!
defender.1000_description: They defended the town from 1000 enemies! Perhaps a more diplomatic approach is warranted.

prolific_crafter.description: Gained by crafting a lot of items.
prolific_crafter.500_description: They crafted 500 items! Maybe they could use an assistant.
prolific_crafter.1000_description: They crafted 1000 items! They'd better have a nice pension lined up.

excellent_crafter.description: Gained by crafting items of excellent quality.

master_crafter.description: Gained by crafting items of masterwork quality.
master_crafter.1_description: They crafted a masterwork quality item! Amazing!
master_crafter.10_description: They crafted 10 masterwork quality items! Incredible!
master_crafter.25_description: They crafted 25 masterwork quality items! Who knew that was even possible?

starving.description: Gained by spending a lot of time being very hungry.
starving.2_description: They've starved for 2 days and are still standing!
starving.3_description: They've starved for 10 days! Perhaps food gathering should be slightly more prioritized.

incapacitated.description: Gained by becoming incapacitated multiple times.
incapacitated.1_description: They have walked the edge of life and death! Exciting!
incapacitated.2_description: They've been knocked down and gotten up just to be knocked back down again...
incapacitated.4_description: They've been incapacitated 4 times! Is it even possible to kill them?
incapacitated.8_description: They've been incapacitated 8 times! Will they ever learn to avoid life-threatening situations?
incapacitated.12_description: They've been incapacitated 12 times! For how long can they trick death like this?
incapacitated.20_description: They've been incapacitated 20 times! It is unbelievable how lucky (or foolish) they are.

swimming.description: Gained by spending a lot of time swimming.
swimming.1_description: They've spent a whole day swimming!
swimming.2_description: They've spent three whole days swimming! They must love water.
swimming.3_description: They've spent a whole month swimming! Such energy!
swimming.4_description: They've spent three months swimming! What?!
swimming.5_description: They've spent half a year swimming! I bet the other half was sleeping...

sweet_energy.description: Gained by eating a lot of sweet foods!
sweet_energy.1_description: They have eaten sweet foods 10 times! Still healthy enough, probably.
sweet_energy.2_description: They have eaten sweet foods 25 times! Who can resist some candy?
sweet_energy.3_description: They have eaten sweet foods 50 times! They really like it!
sweet_energy.4_description: They have eaten sweet foods 100 times! That's a lot, watch out for your sugar levels!
sweet_energy.5_description: They have eaten sweet foods 200 times! That's probably not healthy...
sweet_energy.6_description: They have eaten sweet foods 500 times! Did they even manage to sleep lately?

drunk.description: Gained by spending a lot of time quite woozy because of alcoholic drinks.
drunk.1_description: They've been more there than here for six days! That's a lot!
drunk.2_description: They've spent twelve entire days feeling quite, quite light-headed!
drunk.3_description: They've been drinking for twenty entire days. Are they even working?
drunk.4_description: They've been merry for forty-five days. That's a lot of time to think...
drunk.5_description: They've spent an entire year drinking. Honestly, we should just give them an award!

morning_after.description: Gained by exaggerating a bit too much when drinking...
morning_after.1_description: They did it! No one is perfect, everyone does it eventually... They've had too many drinks and will enjoy a nice morning after...
morning_after.2_description: They have passed the point and had a lot of drinks... Six times already! Perhaps they want some help?
morning_after.3_description: They have had a bad morning after like eighteen times... They probably enjoy it somehow!
morning_after.4_description: They have been there and back again sixty times! Live and die by the bottle, they say...

bee_swarmed.description: Gained by being swarmed by bees.
bee_swarmed.1_description: They have been swarmed by bees once. Ouch, that probably hurts...
bee_swarmed.2_description: They have been swarmed by bees 5 times now! That's a lot, they're definitely not allergic to it.
bee_swarmed.3_description: They have been swarmed by bees 15 times. Do they look like a flower or something? Bees really love them!
bee_swarmed.4_description: They have been swarmed by bees 30 times! This is crazy, maybe bees just really want to follow them. Or maybe you should make them a beekeeper's hat...

none.description: There's no ore in detection range below this point.

some.description: There's some ore below this point, but it might be pretty far down.

lots.description: There's a lot of ore below this point, or it's very close to the surface.

tons.description: You're sitting on a gold mine! (But possibly other ores than gold.)

none.description: Either there's no wilderness here, or it's eclipsed by buildings. Very few trappable animals will be found here.

little.description: This area is very tame. Try planting trees to *spruce* it up a bit. Not very many trappable animals will be found here.

some.description: There's some wilderness here, but it won't attract many animals. A few more or larger plants could help. A normal amount of trappable animals will be found here.

lots.description: This area is rather wild, and plenty of animals should be attracted to it. Many trappable animals will be found here.

tons.description: It's a veritable Garden of Eden! Trappable animals everywhere!

big_game.name: Big Game
big_game.description: Large animals produce large cuts of meat, jerky, pelts, and other useful items

rabid_bear.description: There is something unnatural and wrong with this animal...

large_bear.description: This is a very large bear.

wolf_trainer.description: Whips beasts into a dangerous frenzy

sapper.description: Voluntary sapper. Wants to destroy things!

varanus.description: Taken as an egg to be a war machine

miniboss.description: Seeker of revenge, forever loyal to Ogo!

epic_undead_bow.description: Brings poisoned arrows from the grave...

allow_hunting.description: This hearthling will ignore any wild game they see. Click to allow them to hunt!

avoid_hunting.description: This hearthling will hunt any wild game they see. Click to forbid it!

prepare_mega_pumpkin_soup.description: With a Bundle o' Firewood the Cook can turn this huge vegetable into a wonderful soup!

stomp_mega_cotton_pet_bed.description: Send a Worker to hammer this fluffy mega cotton until it becomes a suitable animal bed.

prepare_mega_watermelon_juice.description: By carving up a hole and stirring inside the Cook can turn this huge fruit into a lot of wonderful juice!

add_thatch_to_bed.description: Make this bed a little more comfortable by adding some thatch to it!

cheese_vat_fill.description: Order the Cook to pour a curdling mixture in this cheese vat to start the production of cheese!

cheese_vat_drain.description: Order the Cook to remove the leftover whey and treat the curds, forming fresh cheese!

carve_furniture.description: Order the Carpenter to transform this big piece of old wood into something new and fashionable!

sculpt_block.description: Order a Worker to chisel this boulder into a nice and useful block to be carried home and worked by a Mason!

sculpt_statue.description: Order the Mason to put their best skills to use and create something beautiful out of this block of stone!

release_fish.description: Let the little creature be free! Just make sure it's in the water...

open_door.description: Open this door and leave it, everyone will be able to go through!

close_door.description: Close this door, preventing animals or creatures from going through.

fermenting_vat_fill.description: Order the Cook or Herbalist to fill this fermenting vat with wort to start brewing! Wort is crafted by the Cook.

build_well_roof.description: Use a crafted Water Well Roof of the same kind to add a fancy roof to make your citizens happier and your water always fresh!

fermenting_vat_gruit.description: Order the Cook or Herbalist to add gruit to the ale, letting it bitter and turn into beer, a more refined drink. Gruit is crafted by the Herbalist.

build_well_clay.description: Order this simple well to be upgraded into a clay water well. Doing so requires Clay Water Well Parts, a refined item that can be crafted by the Potter.

build_well_stone.description: Order this simple well to be upgraded into a stone water well. Doing so requires Stone Water Well Parts, a refined item that can be crafted by the Mason.

build_well_wood.description: Order this simple well to be upgraded into a wooden water well. Doing so requires Wooden Water Well Parts, a refined item that can be crafted by the Carpenter.

build_well_roof_clay.description: Use a crafted Clay Water Well Roof to add a fancy roof to make your citizens happier and your water always fresh! The roof needs to be installed by a worker or the potter.

build_well_roof_stone.description: Use a crafted Stone Water Well Roof to add a fancy roof to make your citizens happier and your water always fresh! The roof needs to be installed by a worker or the mason.

build_well_roof_wood.description: Use a crafted Wooden Water Well Roof to add a fancy roof to make your citizens happier and your water always fresh! The roof needs to be installed by a worker or the carpenter.

fermenting_carboy_fill_unfermented_mead.description: Order the Cook or Herbalist to fill this fermenting vessel with unfermented mead! It can be crafted by the Cook or Herbalist.

fermenting_carboy_fill_unfermented_mead_.description: Order the Cook or Herbalist to fill this fermenting vessel with unfermented fruity mead! It can be crafted by the Cook or Herbalist.

slaughter.description: Harvest this wild animal for some of its resources.
slaughter.disabled_description: This wild animal is unfit for slaughtering.

toggle_training_off.description: This hearthling is currently allowed to train. Click to forbid it!

toggle_training_on.description: This hearthling is currently not allowed to train. Click to allow it!

enable_auto_harvest.description: Enable auto-harvesting of this renewable resource whenever it becomes ready again.

disable_auto_harvest.description: Disable auto-harvesting of this renewable resource.

one_handed_footman.description: This Footman currently prefers using a mainhand weapon and a shield. Click to change!

two_handed_footman.description: This Footman currently prefers using a two-handed weapon. Click to change!

dual_wield_footman.description: This Footman currently prefers using a mainhand weapon with an off-hand weapon. Click to change!

one_handed_knight.description: This Knight currently prefers using a mainhand weapon and a shield. Click to change!

two_handed_knight.description: This Knight currently prefers using a two-handed weapon. Click to change!

bow_archer.description: This Archer currently prefers using a bow. Click to change!

crossbow_archer.description: This Archer currently prefers using a crossbow. Click to change!

manage_parties.description: Manage patrol banners and guard zones (not yet implemented) for this party.

remove_patrol_banner.description: Completely erase the selected patrol banner from this route.

move_patrol_banner.description: Place the selected patrol banner somewhere else, modifying the route.

slow_bolts.description: Currently using spiky bolts, which slows enemy movement speed. Click to swap between bolt types.

default_bolts.description: Using normal bolts. Click to swap to a different bolt type

require_low_fuel.description: Lower Grade Fuel is required to bring this workshop back to action!

require_high_fuel.description: Higher Grade Fuel is required to bring this workshop back to action!

require_fuel.description: Good Grade Fuel is required to bring this workshop back to action!

require_common_fuel.description: Any Common Fuel can be used to bring this workshop back to action!

require_any_fuel.description: Any Fuel can be used to bring this workshop back to action!

capture_fish.description: Order the Trapper to capture this fish instead of harvesting it. A captured fish will remain contained in a small crate that can be placed somewhere else for release.

hamstrung.description: Moving slower because of precisely aimed wounds.

out_of_balance.description: Inflicting less damage due to being out of balance.

lightweight_gear.description: This hearthling is wearing lighter and more agile equipment!

fracture.description: Armor reduced due to shattering damage.

open_wounds.description: Bleeding 6 health points every 10 minutes for 40 minutes.

shaken.description: Courage is reduced, more likely to despair and run away.

major_fracture.description: Armor greatly reduced due to shattering damage.

minor_fracture.description: Armor slightly reduced due to shattering damage.

major_hamstrung.description: Moving much slower because of precisely aimed wounds.

minor_hamstrung.description: Moving slightly slower because of precisely aimed wounds.

minor_open_wounds.description: Bleeding 3 health points every 10 minutes for 40 minutes.

major_open_wounds.description: Bleeding 10 health points every 10 minutes for 40 minutes.

minor_out_of_balance.description: Inflicting a bit less damage due to being out of balance.

major_out_of_balance.description: Inflicting a lot less damage due to being out of balance.

major_shaken.description: Courage is greatly reduced, very likely to despair and run away.

minor_shaken.description: Courage is mildly reduced, might despair and run away.

ice_trap.description: Can't move! Stunned by an ice trap!

not_in_water.description: This creature is not really adapted to being on land... It has consequences!

holiday_cheer.description: Woo! This hearthling is enjoying the holidays with slighly increased compassion and speed!

thorns.description: This hearthling will inflict damage to enemies that attack them.

upset_belly.description: Very uncomfortable. Speed, Diligence and Willpower are reduced.

lovely_meal.description: Eating well is motivating! Diligence and Willpower fairly increased.

armor_light.description: This hearthling is lightly armored and has no speed penalty but reduced courage and menace.

armor_medium.description: This hearthling wears medium armor and has increased courage but slightly lowered speed.

armor_heavy.description: This hearthling is heavily armored and has increased courage and menace but reduced speed.

shield_heavy.description: Defense and courage are increased but speed is slightly reduced.

shield_light.description: Courage is slightly increased but speed is slightly reduced.

chilly_debuff.description: It's a bit cold out here... Might not work as diligently!

cold_debuff.description: It's really cold today! I should get a roof above my head.

animal_cold_debuff.description:
Baby, it's cold outside.
  • This animal will take damage over time if unsheltered.
  • This animal will reproduce somewhat slower.
  • This animal won't produce as much.

freezing_debuff.description:
I'm freezing out here! I need warmth and I need it fast!
  • This hearthling will take damage over time down to 60% of their health if outside.

animal_freezing_debuff.description:
That animal should definitely be sheltered...
  • This animal will take damage over time if unsheltered.
  • This animal will reproduce a lot slower.
  • This animal won't produce as much.

hot_debuff.description: Too sweaty to work. Could use some refreshment!

animal_hot_debuff.description:
The heat is punishing, even for the animals!
  • This animal will reproduce slower.
  • This animal won't produce as much.

sweltering_debuff.description:
I'm sweltering... Should stay indoors or have something refreshing to drink...
  • This hearthling has an increasing chance of getting a sunstroke the longer they stay exposed to the heat.
  • Wearing some sort of head protection like hats, helmets or hoods will prevent heatstrokes.

animal_sweltering_debuff.description:
This heat is unbearable for animals!
  • This animal will reproduce much slower.
  • This animal won't produce as much.

soaked_debuff.description: I'm really wet, my clothes are dripping!

animal_soaked_debuff.description: Not even animals enjoy being this wet.

sunstroke_debuff.description:
So warm... Getting dizzy... I Need refreshment... NOW!
  • This hearthling will take damage over time until they are knocked unconscious.
  • Being sheltered will allow this effect to slowly fade away.
  • Entering the water or drinking something refreshing will remove this effect.

freezing_water_debuff.description:
Oof! This water is so cold, I shouldn't be here!
  • This hearthling will take damage over time down to 10% of their health while in the water.

refreshing_water_buff.description: The water is nice and very refreshing!

chilly_resist_buff.description: This hearthling is protected against chilly weather.

cold_resist_buff.description: This hearthling is protected against cold weather.

freezing_resist_buff.description: This hearthling is protected against freezing weather.

hot_resist_buff.description: Light materials, good airflow or just a handy hat... Should be enough. This hearthling is protected from hot weather.

sweltering_resist_buff.description: Efficient protection against the sun and blazing winds will keep this hearthling safe from the heat of extremely hot weather.

refreshed_buff.description: This was refreshing! Should stay fresh for a while.

warmed_buff.description: I can feel the warmth and it is so cosy! Should feel good for a while.

warmth_source_buff.description: Home is where the hearth is...

chilly_debuff_npc.description: Speed and Damage are slightly reduced.

cold_debuff_npc.description: Speed, Willpower and Damage are somewhat reduced.

freezing_debuff_npc.description: Speed, Willpower and Damage are severely reduced.

compassionate_shepherd_buff.description: Taken care of by a compassionate shepherd. This animal will heal over time, produce more resources, and breed faster.

warm_belly.description:
All warm and fuzzy inside, it was delicious! Willpower is increased.
  • This hearthling is protected from chilly and cold weather for some time

refreshed_belly.description:
This was refreshing, I feel renewed! Diligence is increased.
  • This hearthling is protected from hot weather for some time

sweet_energy.description:
Woo, sugar rush! Diligence is increased, Speed is slightly increased. The need for sleep is slightly decreased.
  • Crafting is slightly faster

light_headed.description:
Having a merry time! Maybe a bit too much... Oh, well. Courage is increased. Diligence, Willpower, Speed and Stamina are slightly decreased.
  • Crafting takes longer and has less chances of producing high quality items
  • This hearthling is less menacing to enemies
  • This hearthling will want to engage in conversations and sleep a lot more than usual

quite_woozy.description:
Is the world spinning or is it just me? Courage is greatly increased. Diligence, Willpower, Speed and Stamina are decreased.
  • Crafting takes longer and has less chances of producing high quality items
  • This hearthling is much less menacing to enemies
  • This hearthling will want to engage in a lot more conversations
  • This hearthling will have the 'The Morning after...' effect applied when this effect expires

morning_after.description:
Ouch... Next time I shouldn't exaggerate so much! Diligence, Willpower and Stamina are greatly reduced.
  • Crafting takes longer
  • This hearthling will not be willing to start conversations

merry_time.description: The hearthling's mood is greatly increased.

fruity_flavors.description:
Enjoyed a delicious fruit beverage! Willpower and Compassion are increased.
  • Crafting is slightly faster

harmony_minor.description:
Hmm... I feel a gentle peace inside. Diligence and Curiosity are slightly increased.
  • Crafting is a little slower but with slightly increased quality
  • Experience gain is slightly increased

harmony.description:
Perfectly balanced, as all things should be. Diligence and Curiosity are increased.
  • Crafting is somewhat slower but with quite increased quality
  • Experience gain is increased

harmony_major.description:
Interior tranquility is the key to understanding oneself. Diligence and Curiosity are quite increased.
  • Crafting is quite slower but with incredibly increased quality
  • Experience gain is greatly increased

thirsty.description: I could probably use something to drink...

very_thirsty.description: My mouth is dry! I really need something to drink!

lovely_drink.description: Nothing more revigorating than having your favorite drink! Stamina and Compassion fairly increased.

toxin_resist.description: This hearthling is protected against weak poisons, toxins and infections.

minor_poison.description:
A weak, non-lethal poison. Will last some hours. Muscle and Willpower are fairly reduced.
  • Losing 5% of their health points every 30 minutes
  • This poison will only damage them down to 75% of their total health

poison.description:
A non-lethal but dangerous poison. Might last a day or so. Muscle and Willpower are reduced.
  • Losing 5% of their health points every 20 minutes
  • This poison will damage them down to only 30% of their total health

major_poison.description:
A tough, lethal poison. Can last a couple of days. Muscle and Willpower are greatly reduced.
  • Losing 5% of their health points every 10 minutes
  • This poison can damage them until they die and require constant medical attention

toxin_sleeping.description: This is a weak toxin. It sticks for longer the more it is applied and will rapidly reduce its target's consciousness, putting them to sleep.

spring_flavors.description:
Ahh! Nothing like cool and fresh water straight from the source! Diligence and Compassion are increased.
  • Crafting has a slightly increased quality chance
  • Experience gain is slightly increased

bee_attack_resist.description: Stings won't bee a problem for this hearthling.

military_expedition.description: These hearthlings might sleep out in the cold and lack some food variety during the first days, true... But it is doubtful that any pesky wolves or goblins will ruin their days later on!
military_expedition.tooltip: A military focused loadout for those that prefer to ensure their safety before everything else.

noble_entourage.description: Not everyone might eat venison, nor are there beds for all... So what? They're not meant for anyone, just for some very special and important hearthlingâor so they sayâthat has everyone else following them into the wild.
noble_entourage.tooltip: A small collection of high value items and professions for an oddly specialized beginning.

dairy_intolerance_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] has a particular sensitivity to dairy products. These just don't get along with their belly.

fish_intolerance_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] has a particular sensitivity to fish or seafood. These just don't get along with their belly.

nuts_intolerance_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] has a particular sensitivity to nuts and hard seeds. These just don't get along with their belly.

dairy_love_trait.description: It is no secret how much [name(i18n_data.entity)] loves dairy products. They always appreciate eating them more than anything else, if possible.

vegetable_love_trait.description: It is no secret how much [name(i18n_data.entity)] loves vegetables. They always appreciate eating them more than anything else, if possible.

meat_love_trait.description: It is no secret how much [name(i18n_data.entity)] loves meat. They always appreciate eating it more than anything else, if possible.

fungi_love_trait.description: It is no secret how much [name(i18n_data.entity)] loves mushrooms of all kinds. They always appreciate eating them more than anything else, if possible.

carnivore_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] just LOVES animals! Especially with hot sauce. However, they really dislike eating vegetables.

herbivore_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] is a friend to all animals! Plants, less so. They really dislike eating meat.

chionophile_trait.description: No one really knows that word. What everyone knows, however, is how much [name(i18n_data.entity)] loves cold and snowy days!

heliophile_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] loves praising the sun! Its light and rays are some of their favorite things and make them really happy.

alcohol_intolerance_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] has a strong dislike for alcoholic beverages. These just don't get along with their belly.

alcohol_love_trait.description: It is no secret how much [name(i18n_data.entity)] loves all types of alcoholic beverages. They always appreciate drinking these more than anything else, if possible.

juice_love_trait.description: It is no secret how much [name(i18n_data.entity)] loves juices. They always appreciate drinking them more than anything else, if possible.

tea_love_trait.description: It is no secret how much [name(i18n_data.entity)] loves all sorts of tea and infusions. They always appreciate drinking them more than anything else, if possible.

light_sleeper_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] is famous for waking up alongside the poyos - or earlier. They will sleep less than most hearthlings but also get tired sooner.

sleepyhead_trait.description: Waking up [name(i18n_data.entity)] can be a challenge. They love sleeping so much that they'll probably sleep a bit more than they should...

level_1_data.training_perk_description: A footman can use Training Dummies to train their combat techniques and earn experience up to Job Level 3

level_3_data.training_complete_description: The footman has finished their combat training and can now seek new opportunities like trying to become a Knight!

level_1_data.training_perk_description: An archer can use Archery Targets to train their precision and earn experience up to Job Level 3

level_2_data.xbow_proficiency_description: The archer is able to use a crossbow to shoot strong bolts at enemies

archer_description.description: A rearguard combatant capable of using ranged weaponry like bows, crossbows and a variety of hindering types of arrows or bolts to attack their foes.

level_1_data.hunting_perk_description: A Northern Alliance archer is naturally adept at animal tracking, and can hunt animals for food and other resources.

level_1_data.training_perk_description: A cleric can use Sheep tamed by a Shepherd to practice their magical gestures and earn experience up to Job Level 3

cleric_description.description: A combat healer that channels holy magic to not only mend wounds but also boost their allies through auras and effects.

level_1_data.training_perk_description: A knight can use Training Dummies to train their defensive taunting skills and earn experience up to Job Level 3
level_1_data.perk_000_description: Increases Stamina, Courage, and draws attention from monsters. Greater fortitude allows the Knight to feel more comfortable in armor, also slightly increasing their Speed.

knight_description.description: A defensive fighter focused on protecting allies from harm and rounding up enemies, striking fear in their hearts!

level_3_data.perk_000_description: The Stamina and Courage bonuses are increased greatly. The Speed bonus is doubled.

knight_horn.description: To strike fear, rally your fellow hearthlings or protect the little ones.

health_1_buff.description: The knight becomes more menacing to enemies, drawing their attention in combat. They also get a health, speed and stamina bonus to keep up.

herbalist_bee_skep_recipe.description: Supplies your town with beekeeping products but won't produce during the winter.
herbalist_bee_skep_recipe.flavor: You can obtain captive bees by harvesting wild bee nests found when cutting trees!

herbalist_beekeeping_hat_recipe.description: Provides protection when working with bees.

worker_beekeeping_hat_recipe.description: Provides protection when hauling and passing by bee skeps or nests.
worker_beekeeping_hat_recipe.flavor: A simpler and lighter variant for all the workers out there!

almond_transmute_recipe.flavor: Only a skilled hand can choose the best nuts, but the rest are destroyed in the process.

daisy_transmute_recipe.flavor: Only a skilled hand can harvest the weaker seeds, but the herbs are lost in the process.

cotton_transmute_recipe.flavor: Only a skilled hand can harvest the weaker seeds, but the fiber is destroyed in the process.

sunflower_transmute_recipe.flavor: Sunflower seeds are oleaginous seeds and can be used to make oil.

dwarfsbeard_transmute_recipe.flavor: Only a skilled hand can harvest the weaker seeds, but the fiber is destroyed in the process.

marblesprout_transmute_recipe.flavor: Only a skilled hand can harvest the weaker seeds, but the flower is lost in the process.

marblesprout_drying_recipe.description: Dry marblesprout flowers to form a hunk of stone used in ornate furniture.

algae_drying_recipe.description: Dry and press thin sheets of algae that can be used as an herb.
algae_drying_recipe.flavor: It is also used in cooking!

parasol_colony_recipe.description: Use existing fungus to create more colonies to grow into new fungi. Slightly toxic when raw, use for cooking!
parasol_colony_recipe.flavor: For creating colonis you need the whole, undeployed fungi - and not just the harvested basket

legendary_parchment_recipe.flavor: So intricate and yet so fragile...

fertilizer_recipe.description: Usable by skilled farmers for slightly improving the quality of their produce.
fertilizer_recipe.flavor: Each sack can be used to fertilize 10 crops

fertilizer_upgrade_recipe.description: Usable by skilled farmers for improving the quality of their produce.
fertilizer_upgrade_recipe.flavor: Each sack can be used to fertilize 12 crops

fertilizer_upgrade_2_recipe.description: Usable by skilled farmers for greatly improving the quality of their produce.
fertilizer_upgrade_2_recipe.flavor: Each sack can be used to fertilize 16 crops

fertilizer_megacrop_recipe.description: This intricate fertilizer doesn't provide the best qualities but will greatly increase the odds of megacrops!
fertilizer_megacrop_recipe.flavor: Each sack can be used to fertilize 20 crops

plant_glass.description: A little thing to make a home feel more cosy.
plant_glass.flavor: Literally handpicked flowers are going to be placed in this vase. Some blossoms might be more striking than others *wink, wink*.

gruit_recipe.description: A bundle of bitter herbs and seasonings. This traditional recipe uses juniper berries.
gruit_recipe.flavor: The Cook or Herbalist can add it to a Fermentation Vat with Ale to make beer

rc_gruit_recipe.description: A bundle of bitter herbs and seasonings. Gruit is often made with wax plants in the desert.
rc_gruit_recipe.flavor: The Cook or Herbalist can add it to a Fermentation Vat with Ale to make beer

na_gruit_recipe.description: A bundle of bitter herbs and seasonings. The northerners use pine cones for its flavor.
na_gruit_recipe.flavor: The Cook or Herbalist can add it to a Fermentation Vat with Ale to make beer

herbalist_cauldron_recipe.description: Used by the Herbalist for brewing & concocting potions.
herbalist_cauldron_recipe.flavor: The wing of a bat, the eye of a newt... Wait, what?

herbalist_cauldron_iron_recipe.description: Used by the Herbalist for better brewing & concocting advanced potions.
herbalist_cauldron_iron_recipe.flavor: The wing of a bat, the eye of a newt... Wait, what?

cook_fermenting_carboy_recipe.description: The Cook and Herbalist can use this to make mead. It requires unfermented mead, crafted by either of them.
cook_fermenting_carboy_recipe.flavor: Mead is appreciated by many but will make hearthlings tipsy

unfermented_mead_recipe.description: A mixture of water, honey and yeast. Within a Carboy it can be turned into mead!
unfermented_mead_recipe.flavor: Take rainwater kept for years, and mix a sextarius of it with a pound of honey -'On Rural Affairs', early Phoenix Empire writings

unfermented_mead_fruit_recipe.description: Like mead, but spiced up with some flavorful fruits. Within a Carboy it can be turned into fruity mead!

herbalist_hood.description: A protective headgear for desert herbalists.

level_2_data.taming_local_flora_description: The Herbalist has acquired sufficient knowledge of the area to learn how to cultivate the local flora
level_2_data.collaborative_insight_description: The Herbalist is now skillful enough to use materials created by the other crafters and is also able to become a Cleric

level_5_data.item_proficiency_2_description: The Herbalist's medical prowess increases the effectiveness of healing items by 100%.

level_6_data.power_medic_3_description: The Herbalist can now attend to up to 6 hearthlings at a time.

herbalist_description.description: A performer of healing practices, the Herbalist can craft and use tonics, bandages and potions but also work with plants, seeds and other foraging goods.

herbalist_mortar_pewter.description: A fancy metallic mortar and pestle for increasing the Herbalist's speed.

herbalist_beekeeping_hat.description: Very useful for being safe while harvesting from bee nests and skeps.

herbalist_bee_skep.description: A neat house for bees, handled by the herbalist. Won't produce during the winter.
herbalist_bee_skep.unripe_description: Not yet ready for harvesting, poor busy little bees!

herbalist_cauldron.description: Used by the Herbalist for brewing & concocting potions.

bronze_crossbow_recipe.description: A strong ranged weapon that is slow but efficient in cracking enemy armor.

steel_crossbow_recipe.description: Not fast but a strong, powerful mechanical weapon that can pierce through armor.

legendary_chainmail_recipe.description: Pieces of silver chainmail linked together for the Vanguard's Chainmail.

legendary_mace_recipe.description: An impressive and powerful knight's weapon.
legendary_mace_recipe.flavor: Engineered to shatter any piece of armor

water_gate_recipe.description: Create a small six-way gate that can be toggled open or closed for controlled fluid flow.

water_pump_recipe.description: Make a pump that will take fluids from the placement level to be released on its upper shaft.
water_pump_recipe.flavor: You can stack up pumps to get water higher and higher!

water_gate_greater_recipe.description: Build a larger and more resistant gate for controlling the flow of fluids.

axle_horizontal_recipe.description: Create a rotating shaft that can take mechanical power forward.

axle_vertical_recipe.description: Create a rotating shaft that can take mechanical power vertically.

axle_gear_box_recipe.description: Build a device that allows you to redirect mechanical power to any direction.
axle_gear_box_recipe.flavor: It can be placed in walls during building - like windows or doors.

bronze_portcullis_large_recipe.description: Useful for fortifying town entrypoints. This is a slightly larger alternative to the Bronze Portcullis.

portcullis_valor_large_recipe.description: For times when only the strongest door will do. This is a slightly larger alternative to the Castle Portcullis.

engineer_description.description: The Engineer is a master of creating contraptions and defenses, repairing facilities and designing mechanisms that can improve other professions.

bone_clay_recipe.description: Required for creating porcelain and beautiful ornate ceramics.

bone_clay_x3_recipe.description: Required for creating porcelain and beautiful ornate ceramics.
bone_clay_x3_recipe.flavor: With the correct ingredients and skill, the potter has mastered a much more efficient way to produce bone clay

clay_animal_door_recipe.description: A large door for animal shelters, it can be closed by a shepherd. When closed, only hearthlings may go through!

clay_animal_door_small_recipe.description: A small door for animal shelters, it can be closed by a shepherd.
clay_animal_door_small_recipe.flavor: When placed on ground level, the two tiles of dirt underneath it must be dug out for it to work!

clay_comfy_bed_recipe.description: It has a lot less sand on the mattress.
clay_comfy_bed_recipe.flavor: For a good night of sleep...

clay_bed_crude_recipe.description: A proper place to pass out when exhausted.
clay_bed_crude_recipe.flavor: 'It's like a pot, for sleeping!' - Clarence, Temporary Salesperson

clay_bed_recipe.flavor: Thatch can be obtained by harvesting grass tufts, some plants like Tumbleweed or digging into grassy terrain

clay_training_dummy_recipe.description: Melee fighters can gain experience from practicing with this friendly guy.

clay_training_target_recipe.description: Ranged fighters can gain experience from practicing with this target.

clay_sword_recipe.description: Required to promote a hearthling into a Footman.
clay_sword_recipe.flavor: Might break easily but ideally they won't use it for long... right?

porcelain_fence_bar_double_recipe.description: Craft a double section of porcelain short wall.

porcelain_fence_bar_single_recipe.description: Craft a single section of porcelain short wall.

porcelain_fence_end_recipe.description: Craft a fencepost for a porcelain short wall.

porcelain_fence_gate_recipe.description: Craft a gate for a porcelain short wall.
porcelain_fence_gate_recipe.flavor: Grants access through tall walls by... magic!

porcelain_wall_lamp_recipe.description: A masterfully crafted lamp dangles on an elegant metal neck.
porcelain_wall_lamp_recipe.flavor: I know it doesn't look that sturdy but it won't break off. I promise.

porcelain_lamp_recipe.flavor: Has little legs for standing. Not running.

porcelain_bench_comfy_recipe.description: Makes for a comfortable living room.
porcelain_bench_comfy_recipe.flavor: Don't let any cats near it!

porcelain_bench_recipe.description: A spacious and exquisite piece of furniture.
porcelain_bench_recipe.flavor: Don't forget to hide the cushions when it rains!

porcelain_chair_comfy_recipe.description: Makes for a comfortable but tidy interior.

porcelain_chair_recipe.description: A simple yet elegant piece of furniture.
porcelain_chair_recipe.flavor: Can also be used as a foot stool

porcelain_comfy_bed_recipe.description: For those that want to look fancy even while asleep.

porcelain_dining_table_recipe.description: Craft a dining table to create a place for eating meals.
porcelain_dining_table_recipe.flavor: Tablecloth included for enhanced visibility of porcelain plates.

porcelain_display_cabinet_recipe.description: A cabinet to show off all the boring pottery that was made before porcelain!

porcelain_display_cupboard_recipe.description: Displays a nice collection of pottery.
porcelain_display_cupboard_recipe.flavor: Just don't nudge it too hard...

porcelain_dresser_recipe.description: Live in luxury with this beautiful piece of furniture.
porcelain_dresser_recipe.flavor: Who even needs to dress up with such a dresser?

porcelain_end_table_recipe.description: A little table to fit a decoration.
porcelain_end_table_recipe.flavor: Fits near your bed, sofa, chair... anywhere!

porcelain_floor_tile_recipe.description: Create a nice porcelain tiled floor for your hearthlings.

porcelain_jar_of_feathers_recipe.description: Gloriously giant feathers made of textiles.
porcelain_jar_of_feathers_recipe.flavor: No poyos were harmed in the making of this decoration.

porcelain_planter_recipe.description: The poetically perfect stand and vase are housing delicate daisies.

porcelain_shelf_recipe.description: In case you'd like to hang things which stand on the ground on your walls.
porcelain_shelf_recipe.flavor: Those are actually sturdy enough to hold a whole hearthling.

porcelain_table_recipe.description: Even in luxury one might want to eat in solitude.

porcelain_teapot_recipe.flavor: The volume barely fits one cup of beverage.

porcelain_urn_short_recipe.description: A simply beautiful piece of decoration.

porcelain_urn_tall_recipe.description: Very fancy and well painted piece of porcelain.

porcelain_wall_tile_gold_recipe.flavor: Reflects light so well it's almost blinding

simple_bed_pet_recipe.description: A slightly better place for hearthlings' pets to sleep.
simple_bed_pet_recipe.flavor: Pets will always try to sleep on the bed that is closest to their owner's bed!

clay_comfy_bed_pet_recipe.description: Allows animals to have a more comfortable sleep.
clay_comfy_bed_pet_recipe.flavor: Pets will always try to sleep on the bed that is closest to their owner's bed!

porcelain_bed_pet_recipe.description: Animals will have a wonderful time sleeping in this bed!

level_2_data.recipe_unlock_2_perk_description: The Mason can now make more elaborate items from stone and can also learn how to work with bone materials.

level_4_data.ornate_perk_description: The Mason has enough skill to refine gold ores or ingots into beautiful and useful Gold Flakes.

level_6_data.mastery_description: The Mason's mastery of their trade allows them to create the most appealing stoneworks imaginable, especially with marble!

iron_brazier_recipe.description: Create a fine piece that provides light and some warmth.

iron_brazier_tall_recipe.flavor: It requires an unit of any coal to be lit

blacksmith_hammer_steel_recipe.description: Forge a new and stronger hammer out of steel for the Blacksmith, improving their crafting speed.
blacksmith_hammer_steel_recipe.flavor: The hammer is a blacksmith's most loyal companion, like a shield to a knight or the moon to the night. -Lucan Varius, Artifex Ignis

carpenter_saw_steel_recipe.description: Make an enhanced steel saw that will allow the Carpenter to be faster when crafting.

trapper_knife_steel_recipe.description: This sharp and light steel knife will allow the trapper to handle animals faster.
trapper_knife_steel_recipe.flavor: What do you mean with *handle* animals?

weaver_spindle_steel_recipe.description: Create a set of elegant, silver coated needles to improve the Weaver's crafting speed.

farmer_hoe_iron_recipe.description: Craft a tool that Farmers can use to slightly improve their working efficiency.
